ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Representation_with_uncertainty is a type of that specifies uncertainty with respect to the elements of representation that it collects. The uncertainty is specified by instances of , and applies to all elements of representation that are expressed in the same measures. In an domain is acoustical engineering, there could be an uncertainty of 1 decibel in the values that represent the relative loudness of sounds.
If uncertainties are specified more than once, the following precedence rules shall apply:
The uncertainty specified for an individual element of representation shall have precedence over the uncertainty specified by any in which the item participates;
The uncertainty specified by an shall have precedence over the uncertainty specified by any in which the representation participates.
This entity may be combined with the entity in an instance, to represent the accuracies that apply to the external geometry. This entity enables to group a subset of the items of a , that conform to particular accuracies. In such a case, the will share the same as the other Representation, stating that their items are founded in a unique context, and have specific uncertainty measures.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Uncertainty_value is the named measure value that defines an uncertainty.
The uncertainty applies to any measure for which it is relevant.
An uncertainty named 'distance accuracy' would be relevant for geometric entities.
The uncertainty value is specified unitless. However, when applied to a measure with unit, this unit applies to the uncertainty value.
